name: Rayyan
description: Rayyan is an AI-powered platform designed to streamline systematic literature reviews and accelerate evidence-based research.
longDescription: Rayyan is a web and mobile-based collaboration platform that leverages artificial intelligence to simplify and accelerate the systematic literature review process for researchers. Founded with the mission to democratize access to advanced research tools, it supports global research communities by enhancing efficiency in evidence synthesis. The platform enables researchers to organize, screen, and manage large volumes of references, reducing screening time by up to 90%. Rayyan’s intuitive interface and AI-driven features, such as automated deduplication and relevance ranking, help researchers focus on high-quality studies. Trusted by over 800,000 researchers worldwide, Rayyan facilitates collaboration across distributed teams and supports offline work via its mobile app. It is developed by Rayyan Systems in partnership with the Qatar Computing Research Institute to advance scientific discovery.
features: AI-powered screening reduces reference review time by up to 90%, enabling faster systematic reviews.
Automated deduplication identifies and removes duplicate references, ensuring a clean dataset.
The mobile app allows researchers to screen articles and collaborate offline, maximizing productivity.
Customizable filters and PICO framework support help quickly identify relevant studies for reviews.
Real-time collaboration tools enable seamless teamwork across distributed research teams.
PRISMA-compliant flow diagrams ensure transparent and reproducible systematic review reporting.
Bulk actions allow researchers to tag, include, or exclude multiple studies simultaneously for efficiency.
Data import from tools like Mendeley, Zotero, and PubMed streamlines reference management.
Random sampling eliminates bias and improves AI relevance rankings during article screening.

faqs.question: What is Rayyan used for?
faqs.answer: Rayyan is used to streamline systematic literature reviews by organizing, screening, and managing references with AI-powered tools.

faqs.question: Is Rayyan free to use?
faqs.answer: Rayyan offers a free plan with up to three active reviews, while premium features like PRISMA diagrams require a subscription.

faqs.question: Can I collaborate with my team on Rayyan?
faqs.answer: Yes, Rayyan supports real-time collaboration, allowing unlimited reviewers to work together on a review.

faqs.question: Does Rayyan work offline?
faqs.answer: Rayyan’s mobile app enables offline work, allowing researchers to screen and manage reviews anywhere.

faqs.question: How does Rayyan’s AI assist in reviews?
faqs.answer: Rayyan’s AI predicts article relevance, automates deduplication, and ranks studies to reduce screening time significantly.

faqs.question: Can I import references from other tools?
faqs.answer: Yes, Rayyan supports importing references from tools like Mendeley, Zotero, EndNote, and PubMed.

faqs.question: What happens if I cancel my subscription?
faqs.answer: Your data remains secure, but premium features like PICO filters are disabled, and excess reviews become read-only.

faqs.question: Does Rayyan comply with research standards?
faqs.answer: Rayyan supports PRISMA guidelines and NIH Data Management policies, ensuring transparency and compliance.
